entry.title: Degrees of Rees polynomial and multiplicity function
entry.summary: Let $J\subset I$ be ideals in a formally equidimensional local ring with $\lambda(I/J)<\infty$ and $J$ is a reduction of $I.$ For all large $n,$ the function $\lambda(I^n/J^n)$ is a polynomial $P(I/J)(X)$ in $n,$ known as Rees polynomial of the pair $(I,J).$ We provide certain classes of ideals such that deg $P(I/J)$ achieves its maximal degree, i.e. $l(J)-1.$ We also study the function $\lambda({\bf I}^{\bf n}/{\bf J}^{\bf n})$ where $J_i\subsetneq I_i$ be ideals in $R$ such that $J_1\cdots J_s\neq I_1\cdots I_s,$ $J_i$ is a reduction of $I_i$ and $\lambda(I_i/J_i)<\infty$ for $i=1,\ldots,s.$ On the other hand, for ideals $J\subset I$ in a formally equidimensional local ring, we consider the multiplicity function $e(I^n/J^n)$ which is a polynomial in $n$ for all large $n.$ We explicitly determine the deg $e(I^n/J^n)$ in some special cases. For an ideal $J$ of analytic deviation one, we give characterization of reductions in terms of deg $e(I^n/J^n)$ under some additional conditions.
entry.arxiv:comment: 20 pages, typos corrected, Theorem 3.7 is modified, Comments are welcome
